name: Asparagus Pasta Salad
description: This asparagus pasta salad with strawberries and balsamic dressing is the perfect spring and summer recipes! I love making it for potlucks, picnics, and BBQs! It's vegan, healthy, and ready in just 20 minutes.
recipeIngredient: 9 oz whole wheat rotini or penne ((for a gluten-free version use brown rice rotini))
2 handful baby arugula or baby spinach

recipeInstructions.text: With a knife, cut off the woody part of the asparagus. Then cut them into about 1.5 inch pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: With a knife, cut off the woody part of the asparagus. Then cut them into about 1.5 inch pieces.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the pasta according to the instructions on the package. Rinse with cold water after cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook the pasta according to the instructions on the package. Rinse with cold water after cooking.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat some oil in a large pan and cook the asparagus on high heat for about 8 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat some oil in a large pan and cook the asparagus on high heat for about 8 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: In the meantime, make the dressing. Combine all the ingredients in a small bowl and whisk well.
recipeInstructions.name: In the meantime, make the dressing. Combine all the ingredients in a small bowl and whisk well.

recipeInstructions.text: Wash and cut the strawberries into slices. In a large bowl combine the cooked asparagus, the strawberries, the pasta, and the arugula or baby spinach. Add the dressing and stir well.

recipeInstructions.text: Top the salad off with balsamic reduction (optional). This salad is best served fresh. I don't like storing it for more than two hours in the fridge because the strawberries soak up the dressing very fast and aren't fresh anymore.
